summary: This document is a chain of emails from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding travel approval requests for prosecutors and investigators working on the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). It details logistical planning for trips to interview witnesses in locations including Pensacola, FL; Los Angeles, CA; West Palm Beach, FL; and Stockholm, Sweden, between 2019 and 2020.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: SDNY employee handling travel logistics and bookings for the investigation team.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: SDNY team member requesting travel to Pensacola, FL, for a witness interview on February 19, 2020, and involved in other trips.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.role: Supervisory Official (likely AUSA or Section Chief)
persons.context: SDNY official approving travel requests for the Epstein investigation team.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: CC'd on multiple travel approval emails within the SDNY.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: SDNY team member traveling for witness interviews in West Palm Beach, Los Angeles, and Pensacola as part of the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Lead prosecutor or senior investigator submitting multiple travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation team to locations including Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, and Stockholm.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: CC'd on a travel approval request email.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the federal investigation (2018R01618) for enticement of minors for sexual activity, referenced as 'United States v. Epstein'.

connections.description: Alex submits travel approval requests to Edward Tyrrell, who grants approval, indicating a supervisor-subordinate or approval chain relationship within the SDNY.
Frequently mentioned together as traveling team members for witness interviews in the Epstein investigation.
Darlene assists Maurene with booking specific flight itineraries for investigation-related travel.
Both are part of the 'team' traveling for interviews, as indicated in multiple requests.
Both are part of the investigation team, with Alex requesting travel for himself and Maurene on specific trips.

events.title: Witness Interview in Pensacola
events.description: Planned interview of a witness in Pensacola, Florida, conducted by SDNY prosecutors/investigators Maurene and Alison as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.description: Planned interview in West Palm Beach, Florida, conducted by Alex and Maurene.

events.title: Meetings and Interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Travel for approximately three days for meetings and interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, for the case United States v. Epstein.

keyFacts: The document reveals active SDNY investigation travel for witness interviews in the Epstein case (2018R01618) from at least March 2019 through February 2020.
Investigation activities included domestic travel to Florida (Pensacola, West Palm Beach) and California (Los Angeles), and international travel to Sweden, indicating a broad witness pool.
The team frequently requested and used hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews.
Travel requests were explicitly for the investigation 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
The email chain shows a standardized approval process within the SDNY for investigation-related travel, with Edward Tyrrell as the consistent approver.
